name: Japanese Economy　01
category: 日本をめぐる政治経済-必修科目
subtitle: Post-war Japanese economy and current issues through the lens of economic theory
textbook: Naoyuki Yoshino et al., 2010, The Postwar Japanese Economy: Eigo de Manabu Nihon Keizai. Tokyo: Yuhikaku.

evaluation_method.name: 試験
evaluation_method.detail: Final exam. Question types: Short answers.

evaluation_method.name: その他
evaluation_method.detail: There will be a reviewing quiz at the end of each class between classes 2-14. Four points are the full mark for each quiz. The sum of quiz scores is added to the final grade up to 25 points.

name: Comparative Economic History A　01
category: 日本をめぐる政治経済-必修科目以外
subtitle: What is global history?
textbook: Sebastian Conrad, What Is Global History? (Princeton University Press, 2016)

evaluation_method.name: 試験
evaluation_method.detail: Instead of examination, it is compulsory each student act a presenter and a commentator at least once.

evaluation_method.name: レポート
evaluation_method.detail: At the end of final class, each student should submit his/her own plan for writing MA thesis for global economic history, adding to the list of previous works and sources should be examined.

evaluation_method.name: その他
evaluation_method.detail: To what extent each student attends the discussion and how far he/she could contribute to raise the standard of discussion.

name: Asian Economic Development　01
category: 日本をめぐる政治経済-必修科目以外
field_small: 国際経済学・開発経済学
level: 中級レベル（発展・応用）
textbook:
1. The East Asian Miracle, World Bank, Oxford University Press, 1993.
2. Rethinking the East Asian Miracle, Joseph E. Stiglitz and Shahid Yusuf, World Bank, 2001.

evaluation_method.name: 試験
evaluation_method.detail: All participants are required to participate in the debating class and make his/her contribution to the group presentations. No any exceptions are allowed. No excuse for absence is accepted.

evaluation_method.name: レポート
evaluation_method.detail: All participants are required to submit a high quality essay by the end of the semester.

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail:
Attendance is regarded as an important evidence to assess the credit.
The performance in the class (question-asking, involvement in discussion, idea contribution) is also regarded as evaluation evidence.

name: Global Politics　01
level: 中級レベル（発展・応用）
textbook: Jeffry A. Frieden, David A. Lake, and Kenneth A. Schultz. 2011. World Politics: Interests, Interactions, and Institutions. 2nd Edition. Norton.

evaluation_method.name: 試験
evaluation_method.detail: The final exam consists of identification, short-answer, and/or essay questions.

evaluation_method.name: レポート
evaluation_method.detail: You will submit one policy commentary before the winter breaky. You will evaluate the argument and/or assessment in the assigned article, using the concept, model, or empirical findings discussed in the class. Your essay should also identify the underlying causal mechanism of the policy issue and either suggest policy implications or offer policy recommendations. The essay should be five-page long, double-spaced.

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail: Attendance will count for 10% of the grade.

name: Local Government　01
time: 集中講義（春学期）  無2-4
level: 中級レベル（発展・応用）
textbook:
”Local Government in Japan、2016”, Council of Local Authorities for　International　Relations　（CLAIR）

http://www.clair.or.jp/j/forum/pub/docs/jichi-en_1.pdf

Chinese, Korean、and French language versions are also available at the following CLAIR site.

http://www.clair.or.jp/j/forum/pub/dynamic/local_government.html?c=100602&limit=20

Students are required to read this pdf file prior to the course.
Classroom lectures will not follow or explain this material.

evaluation_method.name: 試験
evaluation_method.detail: A few quizzes may be given.

evaluation_method.name: レポート
evaluation_method.detail: An essay based on the course material and classroom discussion. The questions will be decided through consultation during the course, and students will be given sufficient instruction to prepare. In class, closed-book exam.

name: Public Finance　01
field_small: 財政学・公共経済学・経済政策
level: 中級レベル（発展・応用）
textbook: None

evaluation_method.name: レポート
evaluation_method.detail:
Students are required to submit the term-paper in the end of the class.
Evaluation is based on the term-paper.

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail: Evaluation is based on the attendance(mandatory)。

field_small: 実験経済学 / 行動経済学

textbook: Joel Watson, 2013, Strategy: An Introduction to Game Theory (Third Edition), W.W. Norton and Company

name: Advanced Seminar 1　01
professor: ケラム　マリサ　アンドレア
subtitle: Comparative Politics of Developing Countries
textbook:
Shaping the Developing World (2014), by Andy Baker. CQ Press

Students do not need to purchase this textbook. It will be available through the library.

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail:
(25%) Reading outlines: students will be assigned weeks when they must prepare an outline of the assigned reading to distribute to other students and present the main points of the reading to the seminar and lead discussion
(25%) Case studies: students will research and present short case studies related to the reading
(25%) Data analysis: students will research empirical measures and present a very simple analysis
(25%) Participation: even when they are not assigned to outline & present the reading assignment, students should still raise questions and contribute to the discussion

name: Advanced Seminar 1　02
subtitle: Overview of the US subprime mortgage crisis of 2007-2008

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail: Attendance and presentations during the class.

name: Advanced Seminar 1　03
professor: ヴェステグ　ロベルト　フェレンツ
subtitle: Topics in Microeconomics and Game Theory
textbook: There is no textbook for this seminar. We are going to read selected chapters from the books on the reference list and also discuss several research papers.

name: Advanced Seminar 1　04
subtitle: Comparative Political Economy
textbook: William R. Clark, Matt Golder, and Sona N. Golder, 2012, Priniples of Comparative Politics 2nd edition, Sage (There is a possibility that we will use the third edition.)

name: Advanced Seminar 1　05
subtitle: Empirical analysis of global macroeconomic and financial issues
textbook: We apply undergraduate level of macroeconomics and money and finance to examine recent reports from international financial institutions and fiscal and monetary authorities. We often refer to textbooks used in Macroeconomics A/B and Money and Banking courses (listed below).

name: Advanced Seminar 1　07
subtitle: Economics and Politics of Food
textbook: Required readings will be assigned.

name: Advanced Seminar 1　08
subtitle: Political culture
textbook: No textbook; students will be given reading assignments in class.

name: Advanced Seminar 1　09
subtitle: Firms and Organizations in Japan I
textbook: None

name: Advanced Seminar 1　10
professor: クヴァソフ　デミトリ
subtitle: Economics of Equity, Fairness, and Justice

1. H. Peyton Young (1994). Equity: In Theory and Practice.
2. Herve J. Moulin (2003). Fair Division and Collective Welfare
3. Herve Moulin (1995). Cooperative Microeconomics: A Game-.theoretic Introduction.

name: Advanced Seminar 1　11
level: 中級レベル（発展・応用）
textbook:
Wheelan, Charles J. 2013. Naked Statistics: Stripping the Dread from the Data.
Reinhart, Alex. 2015. Statistics Done Wrong: The Woefully Complete Guide.

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail: In-class participation (more than 3 absences will result in 0 score in this category)

name: Advanced Seminar 1　12
level: 中級レベル（発展・応用）
subtitle: The International Political Economy of East Asia
textbook:
No textbook is compulsory for this class. Each session will have some (1 or 2) required readings.
You will two sorts of readings:
An academic reading which presents a seminal aspect of the theory of IPE.
A case study reading which allow us to make practical use if IPE in the East Asian context.
The complete bibliography and readings per each session will be uploaded before the beginning of the semester and will be accessible on the coursen@vi page of the seminar.
The complete bibliography and readings per each session will be uploaded before the beginning of the semester and will be accessible on the coursen@vi page of the seminar.

Here are just some references that can be useful for reviewing this course:


Here are just some references that can be useful for reviewing this course:


Thomas Oatley [2008], International Political Economy: Pearson, New York.
George T. Crane & Abla Amawi, The Theorical Evolution of International Political Economy: a reader,
Robert Gilpin [2001], Global Political Economy: Understanding the International Economic Order: Princeton University Press.

evaluation_method.name: 試験
evaluation_method.detail: During the last session you will have to present in class your research and your conclusions.

evaluation_method.name: レポート
evaluation_method.detail:
By the end of the semester you must write a research paper. A list of topics will be announced during the first session.
The choice of topics and academic expectations will be discussed in class.
Your paper should be 5,000 words (+/- 10%)

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail:
TClass participation is highly recommended. In class you will have to present the progress of your research paper, comment the assigned reading, and propose your own explanation of contemporary problems.
This seminar relies on debates and exchanges of views. Comments, questions are welcomed.

evaluation_method.name: その他
evaluation_method.detail: Active pariticipation and attendance (no more than 4 absences will be accepted)

evaluation_method.name: 試験

Understanding of basic approaches and analyses in this lecture will be assessed.　
(Please note that students who do not fulfill the required attendance，namely, 2/3 of the regular classes，in the regulation of the School of Political Science and Economics, will be disqualified even though they sit for /submit the term end examination. )

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail: On some occasions, comment／discussion sheet will be distributed and collected to assess degree of participation and constant and keen participation in the class will be valued.

subtitle: Nationalism and Capitalism

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail: Attendance and active participation in discussions. Students are also required to give three presentations during the term: the first is a group presentation on the Iwakura mission; the second is a group presentation on a field trip to the Edo-Tokyo Museum; and the third is an individual end-of-term research presentation based on their term-paper.

Test:40%

name: Theories of International Relations　01
level: 中級レベル（発展・応用）
textbook:
No textbook is compulsory for this class. Each session will have some (1 or 2) required readings.
The complete bibliography and readings per each session will be uploaded before the beginning of the semester and will be accessible on the coursen@vi page of the seminar.

Here are just some references that can be useful for reviewing this course:

Robert Godin[2009], The Oxford Handbook of Political Science, Oxford University Press, Oxford=> parties VII et VIII.
Christian Reus‐Smit & Duncan Snidal (dir.) [2008], The Oxford Handbook of International Relations, Oxford University Press, Oxford
Steve Smith, Amelia Hadfield & Tim Dunne [2007], Foreign Policies: theories, actors, cases, Oxford University Press, Oxford.
Tim Dunne, Milja Kurki & Steve Smith [2010], International Relations Theories: discipline and diversity, Oxford University Press, Oxford.
John W. Young & John Kent [2003], International Relations since 1945: a global history, Oxford University Press, Oxford

evaluation_method.name: 試験
evaluation_method.detail: The final exam is a sitting exam. Methodology and expected standards will be detailed during the course.

evaluation_method.name: レポート
evaluation_method.detail:
By the end of the course you must write a research paper. Your paper brings a theoretical perspective on a practical situation. Your essay must be an analysis of a real world situation.
The choice of topics will be discussed in class.
Your paper brings a theoretical perspective on a practical situation. The body of your essay should size 7 A4 pages (times new roman 12, with double-spacing, standard margins) + end notes.

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail: Class participation is highly encouraged. Do not hesitate to ask questions or to make comments. Since each session will focus on a specific text, you can express your personal point of view.

evaluation_method.name: その他
evaluation_method.detail: Attendance (no more than 4 absences will be accepted)

evaluation_method.name: レポート
evaluation_method.detail:
Report(s)
Each assignment complements materials covered in the class. It focuses mostly on applications of theoretical concepts using statistical packages. It is strongly encouraged to work together with your classmates to do problem sets. It is an important element in learning process. However, it does not mean that you can copy and paste your friends’ answer as yours. No academic misconduct will be tolerated.

The chapters that will be covered in this class are almost identical in both editions. You can purchase the book at the university bookstore or amazon.co.jp.)

name: Global Leadership Fellows Program (GLFP): Directed Research Seminar - Theories and Methods of Political Science (Fall)　01
professor: ケラム　マリサ　アンドレア
subtitle: Directed Research Seminar in Theories and Methods of Political Science, Part I (Fall Semester)
textbook: There is no textbook. Reading assignments consist of scholarly articles and book chapters.

evaluation_method.name: レポート
evaluation_method.detail:
Reading response papers: 30%
Students must submit 6 short papers (appx. 500 words) that offer a critical response to a weekly set of readings. A good response paper will include a one-paragraph summary of the main contributions, a one-paragraph critique of the limitations of the readings, and two questions raised by the readings that you would like to discuss in the seminar.

Final Reflection essay: 20%
The reflection prompt will be distributed in week 14. Essays (about 5-7 pages) are due at the start of class in week 15.

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail: Participation: the educational value of the seminar largely depends on the quality of class participation and student engagement. It is essential that students complete the readings prior to the session in which the readings are assigned, attend all sessions, and speak up in class!

evaluation_method.name: その他
evaluation_method.detail: Presentations: For each week, different students will take responsibility for presenting the readings and leading the seminar discussion. (Students will be assigned to readings at the beginning of the semester.)
